# Typography

```
yarn add @devseed-ui/typography
```

```js
import {
  Heading,
  Overline,
  Lead,
  Subtitle,
  Prose,
  Table,
  createHeadingStyles,
  createOverlineStyles,
  createSubtitleStyles,
  createProseStyles,
  createTableStyles,
  renderHeadingSize,
  renderTableZebra,
} from '@devseed-ui/typography';
```

## Heading

Heading is a default component to display action in a page.

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Heading"
    argTypes={{
      size: {
        name: 'size',
        type: { name: 'string', required: false },
        defaultValue: 'medium',
        description: 'Sets the heading size',
        table: {
          category: 'Heading',
          type: { summary: 'string' },
          defaultValue: { summary: 'medium' },
        },
        control: {
          type: 'select',
        },
        options: ['xxsmall', 'xsmall', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'xlarge', 'xxlarge', 'jumbo'],
      },
      variation: {
        name: 'variation',
        type: { name: 'string', required: false },
        defaultValue: 'base',
        description: 'Sets the heading color',
        table: {
          category: 'Heading',
          type: { summary: 'string' },
          defaultValue: { summary: 'base' },
        },
        control: {
          type: 'select',
        },
        options: Object.keys(theme.main.color),
      },
      className: {
        name: 'className',
        type: { name: 'string', required: false },
        description: 'Add CSS class names for addtional styling',
        table: {
          category: 'Heading',
          type: { summary: 'string' },
        },
        control: {
          type: 'text',
        },
      },
      as: {
        name: 'as',
        type: { name: 'string', required: false },
        defaultValue: 'h1',
        description: 'Specify the element used to render the heading',
        table: {
          category: 'Heading',
          type: { summary: 'string' },
          defaultValue: { summary: 'h1' },
        },
        control: {
          type: 'select',
        },
        options: ['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6'],
      },
    }}
  >
    {args => (
      <Heading
        as={args.as}
        size={args.size}
        variation={args.variation}
        className={args.className}
      >
        Heading
      </Heading>
    )}
  </Story>
</Canvas>

<ArgsTable story="Heading" />

### Create heading styles
Some third-party libraries do no allow for their components to be replaced with custom ones, but it will be possible to reach the needed elements using a css selector and then applying the same styles.  
To apply heading styles to other elements (like headings provided by third-party components), you can use `createHeadingStyles(props)` inside your `styled-components`. It accepts the same props as `Heading`.

```jsx
const Comp = styled.div`
  .third-party {
    ${createHeadingStyles({ size: 'small' })}
  }
`;
```

#### Accessibility

- Do **not** use headings to change the text size of an element.
- Always specify the heading level according to the page hierarchy:
  - Use at most one `h1` heading per page.
  - Keep the heading level order intact. Never skip a heading level or place lower levels before higher levels (ie. `h3` before `h2`)


Read [Heading Levels Accessibility Concerns](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements#accessibility_concerns) on MDN for more information.

## Overline

Adds additional text above the headline. 

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Overline"
  >
    <Overline>Overline</Overline>
    <Heading>Heading</Heading>
  </Story>
</Canvas>

### Create overline styles
Use `createOverlineStyles(props)` inside your `styled-components`. It accepts the same props as `Overline`. See [reasoning above](#create-heading-styles).

## Subtitle

Adds a subtitle, usually underneath the heading. 

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Subtitle"
  >
    <Heading>Heading</Heading>
    <Subtitle>Subtitle</Subtitle>
  </Story>
</Canvas>

### Create subtitle styles
Use `createSubtitleStyles(props)` inside your `styled-components`. It accepts the same props as `Subtitle`. See [reasoning above](#create-heading-styles).

## Lead

Adds a lead paragraph in larger type, usually added directly after the headline.

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Lead"
  >
    <Heading>Heading</Heading>
    <Lead>
     Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc dignissim et mi sit amet pellentesque. Fusce tincidunt sagittis eleifend. Nullam quis quam nec ligula bibendum imperdiet. Phasellus sodales, diam in fringilla egestas, ligula tellus egestas neque, eu placerat quam tellus id magna. Pellentesque porta fermentum sagittis. Phasellus sed diam vitae.
   </Lead>
  </Story>
</Canvas>

## Table

Renders a table. Accepts common table elements (`caption`, `thead`, `tbody`, `tfoot`, `tr`, `th`, `td`) as children and applies styling. 

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Table"
    argTypes={{
      zebra: {
        name: 'zebra',
        type: { name: 'boolean', required: false },
        defaultValue: false,
        description: 'Indicates whether to highlight odd rows using a darker background.',
        table: {
          category: 'Table',
          type: { summary: 'boolean' },
          defaultValue: { summary: false },
        },
        control: {
          type: 'boolean',
        },
      },
    }}
  >
    {args => (
      <Table zebra={args.zebra}>
        <caption>This is a table caption</caption>
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th scope="col">#</th>
            <th scope="col">Lorem</th>
            <th scope="col">Ipsum Dolor</th>
            <th scope="col">Sit Amet</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          <tr>
            <th scope="row">1</th>
            <td>Aliquam erat</td>
            <td>Volutpat</td>
            <td>Praesent</td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <th scope="row">2</th>
            <td>Aenean</td>
            <td>Finibus</td>
            <td>Accumsan</td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <th scope="row">3</th>
            <td>Phasellus</td>
            <td>Consequat</td>
            <td>Vivamus</td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <th scope="row">4</th>
            <td>Farfalla</td>
            <td>Vendetta</td>
            <td>Spaghetti</td>
          </tr>
        </tbody>
        <tfoot>
          <tr>
            <th scope="row">Total</th>
            <td>20</td>
            <td>300.00â‚¬</td>
            <td>450</td>
          </tr>
        </tfoot>
      </Table>
    )}
  </Story>
</Canvas>

<ArgsTable story="Table" />

### Create table styles
Use `createTableStyles(props)` inside your `styled-components`. It accepts the same props as `Table`. See [reasoning above](#create-heading-styles).

## Prose

A wrapper component to layout long-form writing including headlines, paragraphs, lists, tables, and figures. `Prose` accepts any valid node as children; the following elements will be automattically styled:

- Headlines (`h1` - `h6`)
- Paragraphs (`p`)
- Lists (`ol`, `ul`, `dl`)
- Figures (`figure` with children `figcaption` and `img`)
- Table (`table`)

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Prose"
  >
    <Prose>
      <h1>Headline</h1>
      <p>
        Nulla fermentum odio eget lacus condimentum, sed volutpat tortor
        pellentesque. Nulla placerat scelerisque lorem at pharetra.
      </p>
      <dl>
        <dt>Phasellus</dt>
        <dd>Ex viverra eros cursus</dd>
        <dt>Pellentesque non nec lorem</dt>
        <dd>Nunc tempus, mi eu suscipit</dd>
        <dt>pellentesque, elit leo finibus</dt>
        <dd>Lorem ipsum dolor</dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
        Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra,
        per inceptos himenaeos. Etiam risus tortor, dapibus sed porttitor
        eu, pharetra eu eros. Donec id rutrum elit, vel accumsan urna. Ut
        tincidunt cursus nulla, sit amet aliquet felis. Aliquam consectetur
        non lacus malesuada dignissim.
      </p>
      <figure>
        <img
          src="https://source.unsplash.com/random/1000x400"
          alt="Placeholder"
        />
        <figcaption>An image from Unsplash</figcaption>
      </figure>
    </Prose>
  </Story>
</Canvas>

### Create prose styles
Use `createProseStyles(props)` inside your `styled-components`. It accepts the same props as `Prose`. See [reasoning above](#create-heading-styles).
